pr_title: chore: emit metrics with ksql.service.id in metrics tag

update tag with underscores instead of .
chore: emit metrics with ksql.service.id in metrics tag

update tag with underscores instead of .

timeline.bodyText: Why are we changing the name and group for legacy metric here?
timeline.author: harinirajendran
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -298,15 +307,19 @@ private void configureMetric(
       final KsqlMetric metric) {
     // legacy
     sensor.add(
-        metrics.metricName(ksqlServiceId + metric.name(), metricGroupName, metric.description()),
+        metrics.metricName(
+            metric.name(),

replies.bodyText: In master there are currently 2 sets of metrics, legacy ones with the service id in the metric name and "new" metrics with the service id in the metric group name. The legacy ones are from a while ago and we should be able to remove them now, so now the metrics with the service id in the metric group name are considered legacy and the metrics with the service id in the metric tag is "new"
replies.author: stevenpyzhang

timeline.bodyText: Why are we changing the name and group for legacy metric here?
timeline.author: harinirajendran
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -346,16 +359,16 @@ private void configureNumActiveQueriesForGivenState(
     final String name = state + "-queries";
     // legacy
     configureGaugeForState(
-        ksqlServiceId + metricGroupName + "-" + name,
-        metricGroupName,
-        Collections.emptyMap(),
+        name,
+        ksqlServiceIdLegacyPrefix + metricGroupName,

timeline.bodyText:
Could this be more efficient as it does 1 copy instead of 2?.
this.newCustomMetricsTags = ImmutableMap.<String, String>builder()
       .putAll(customMetricsTags)
       .put(KsqlConstants.KSQL_SERVICE_ID_METRICS_TAG, ksqlEngine.getServiceId())
       .build();
timeline.author: spena
